items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. No further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge continue to fall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 26 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today Tuesday 25 November 2025 and for the next few days. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Wednesday 26 November 2025. or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, local roads and low-lying land around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 26 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: River levels remain high and flooding is possible overnight. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Low Marishes area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 26 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding continues today. Flooding is possible on 25 November 2025 . Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech peaked at 2.99m on 24/11/25 and Cae Howel 3.6m to 3.7m on 25/11/25 Tuesday afternoon. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 26 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Tidal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected. The tidal forecast for the coming tides is now below flood risk thresholds. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water

High river levels are expected to cause flooding overnight. Flooding is expected on Tuesday, 25 November 2025 and overnight into Wednesday. Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. 
This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 26 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
